column4: i need some help rescuing my ubuntu desktop..     it keeps freezing during boot. it will act like it's about to go to the login manager,   and then die, black-screen, most of the time...    other times, i'll get a stalled "working cursor, but still no login,  and other times, it's fine.
Just walk away for a bit
the gentoo it's dual-booted with boots fine every time.
YOu probably have a Dell
custom build.
Jmisrvrox: :| I hate it, I have three network cards, my best one doesnt work >.<
Ndshacker: any other ideas?
kc8: I get the same error if I dotn do some tweaks
kc8: do you get any probs in the recovery console?
what tweaks?  I've not tried recovery console much yet. it's our font-desk computer. I'm not at the shop.
Mine had a problem with the network card, so... its probably a hardwar malfunction causing it
I had to blacklist a few processes to fix it
like???   i need to appease the ubuntu people at the shop.
lolz
What is it running on?
.........  i forget the board, but it's an amd64 3200+ with s 200 gb sata, and 1gb ram
onboard networking controller?
yes.
Bah
Try recovery console
Thank god for linux, it just helped me get a windows driver O.O
For what?
there are lots of terminal commands

what bothers me, is that it was working fine, then someone killed the power while it was on,  and it's been flaky under ubuntu ever since,  but i CANNOT get teh same flakiness out of the gentoo that's also on the same box.
